metadata.name: .RDP File Created by Outlook Process
metadata.comment: Detects the creation of files with the ".rdp" extensions in the temporary directory that Outlook uses when opening attachments. This can be used to detect spear-phishing campaigns that use RDP files as attachments.

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM file_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND endswith(lower(file.path), lower('.rdp')) AND (contains(lower(file.path), lower('\\appdata\\local\\packages\\microsoft.outlook_')) OR contains(lower(file.path), lower('\\appdata\\local\\microsoft\\olk\\attachments\\'))) AND contains(lower(file.path), lower('\\appdata\\local\\microsoft\\windows\\')) AND contains(lower(file.path), lower('\\content.outlook\\')))

output.summary: Detects the creation of files with the ".rdp" extensions in the temporary directory that Outlook uses when opening attachments. This can be used to detect spear-phishing campaigns that use RDP files as attachments.

metadata.objective: False positive: Whenever someone receives an RDP file as an email attachment and decides to save or open it right from the attachments References: https://thecyberexpress.com/rogue-rdp-files-used-in-ukraine-cyberattacks/, https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/security/blog/2024/10/29/midnight-blizzard-conducts-large-scale-spear-phishing-campaign-using-rdp-files/, https://www.linkedin.com/feed/update/urn:li:ugcPost:7257437202706493443?commentUrn=urn%3Ali%3Acomment%3A%28ugcPost%3A7257437202706493443%2C7257522819985543168%29&dashCommentUrn=urn%3Ali%3Afsd_comment%3A%287257522819985543168%2Curn%3Ali%3AugcPost%3A7257437202706493443%29
